entry.title: SAP B1 SP 2411, how to log in as different user
entry.content:
Hello,

In older versions I could log in as another user to check their settings, by typing in a username and password.
In version 2411 login is via SSO.
How can I log in as another user, if I know their username and password?

Thank you in advance,

Marina Levy

entry.title: Stored procedure with a Temp table output fields not visible in crystal report
entry.content:
I have a legacy crystal report that I need to modify . The report is based on a single stored procedure. The proc simply inserts data into a  temp table ( eg  #TempTable01)  and does a select * from  #TempTable01 at the end and also does a drop table .

This is currently working ,  if I extract the Crystal report for editing I can see the fields.

HOWEVER,  if I change the connection in design time ( I need to make some modifications so...) , 

the moment I change the connection the fields disappear from the field explorer.  Removing and re-adding the proc to the report has not helped.

This is a SQL Server based report and I have only tried OLEDB ADO.

entry.title: Inventory Audit Report Performance Issue – Extremely Long Runtime / Timeouts (SAP Business One)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am looking for assistance with a performance issue related to the Inventory Audit Report in SAP Business One.

System Landscape

  • SAP Business One Version: 10.0 FP 2405

  • Database: Microsoft SQL Server 2019

  • Database Size: ~57 GB

  • Server OS: Microsoft Windows Server 2019 Standard

  • Server Deployment: Cloud

  • Client Type: SAP Business One Windows Client

Issue Description

The client is experiencing very long execution times when running the standard Inventory Audit Report.

  • The report takes an excessive amount of time to load and frequently times out.

  • This behavior occurs even when running the report for a single day.

  • Due to the long runtime and timeout behavior, the report is effectively unusable.

  • The issue is consistent and reproducible.

Additional Observations

  • No customizations or modifications have been made to the standard Inventory Audit Report.

  • The issue occurs regardless of the user executing the report.

  • Other inventory-related reports execute normally or significantly faster in comparison.

  • Although the database contains historical inventory data, the issue still occurs with very small date ranges.

Business Impact

The Inventory Audit Report is required for:

  • Inventory reconciliation

  • Audit and compliance activities

  • Historical stock movement validation

At this time, the client cannot rely on this report due to the performance limitations.

Request for Assistance

We would appreciate guidance on:

  • Known performance issues with the Inventory Audit Report in SAP Business One 10 FP 2405

  • SAP Notes or known corrections related to this report

  • Recommended configuration or best practices to improve performance

  • Whether this behavior has been addressed in later Feature Packs or patches

Any insights, recommendations, or shared experiences would be highly appreciated.

Thank you

entry.content:

entry.title: SAP Business One Service Layer – Copy From Landed Cost to A/P Invoice (BaseType 69 Not Supported)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am working on SAP Business One 10.0 using the Service Layer (v2) to automate broker invoice posting as part of an AI / Agentic Automation application.

Business Scenario (GUI)

In SAP GUI, users:

  • Open A/P Invoice

  • Click Copy From → Landed Cost

  • Select the broker Landed Cost
    SAP automatically:

  • Creates the A/P Invoice

  • Builds the Relationship Map link between Landed Cost and the invoice

API Scenario (Service Layer)

Using Service Layer, I:

  • Retrieve the Landed Cost via /LandedCosts

  • Create the broker A/P Invoice via /PurchaseInvoices

When I attempt to link the invoice line using:

  • BaseType = 69 (Landed Cost)

  • BaseEntry = <LandedCost DocEntry>

SAP returns the error:
“BaseType 69 is not valid”

From my research, Service Layer does not support “Copy From Landed Cost”, and no relationship is created in the Relationship Map when posting via API.

Questions

  1. Is there any supported way to create a Landed Cost → A/P Invoice relationship using Service Layer?

  2. If Service Layer does not support this, what is the recommended enterprise approach?

    • DI API / SDK add-on?

    • Referenced Documents?

    • Any other SAP-supported pattern?

  3. How do customers usually automate this process while preserving the Relationship Map, especially in AI or RPA-driven solutions?

Any guidance or best practices would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance.

Best regards,
Zain

 

@ANKIT_CHAUHAN 

@Chris1973 

@Lakshmipathi 

@dawid90

SAP Business One

entry.title: Bin Location Content List shows quantity in source bin after bin-to-bin transfer in SAP Business One
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I need some clarification on a behavior observed in SAP Business One related to bin-managed warehouses.

Scenario

In a bin-managed warehouse, the Bin Location Content List report continues to show quantity in the source bin even after the stock has been transferred to another bin. I understand this could be standard SAP behavior, but I would like to understand the underlying logic and whether any workaround is available.

Steps to reproduce the issue:

  1. Create a Goods Receipt PO into Warehouse 1 and assign the stock to ABC bin.

  2. Perform a bin-to-bin transfer from ABC bin to XYZ bin.

  3. Run the Bin Location Content List report for the same item.

Actual result:

The quantity is still displayed in the ABC bin in the Bin Location Content List.

Expected result:

The quantity in ABC bin should be zero or no longer displayed, as the stock has already been transferred to XYZ bin.

Questions:

  • Is this behavior by design in SAP Business One?

  • What is the technical or functional reason for the quantity still appearing in the source bin?

  • Is there any recommended workaround or alternative report to reflect the real-time bin balance correctly?

  • Are there any specific settings, refresh logic, or known SAP Notes related to this behavior?

Any insights or best practices from SAP consultants or experts would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your support.

Best regards,

Sunil Patil

Certified SAP Business One Consultant

entry.title: b1if 2.0 B1SL Add/Update call returnData empty
entry.content:
I'm exploring b1if 2.0 service layer Add and Update calls using a BizIOs (B1SL Adapter Type). Add and Updates are working, but I want to add error handling.

Currently, the error message returns nothing but the HTTP status code: 400, Bad Request.

What can be done to expose further error details?

I'm on Version 2.0.47.

entry.title: Why SAP B1 Landed Cost Distribution Rule not copy over to AP broker invoice
entry.content:
My company is using SAP B1 Ver 10, SP2411.
In Doc setting - Landed Cost - Enable multiple broker invoices
Scenario:
- In Goods Receipt PO, there are 3 lines and each line has different Distribution Rule.
- In Landed Cost, key in Vendor and Broker's BP ID, copy from above GR PO, all 3 lines copied with Distribution Rule.
- In AP invoice, key in Broker's ID, copy from above Landed Cost.
Question:
1) AP invoice doc type automatically change to service. Is this system standard behaviour?
2) AP invoice Distribution Rule is blank. Why Distribution Rule not copy from Landed Cost to AP invoice?
3) Tested with 1 line in GR PO and key in 1 distribution rule > landed cost copy from GR PO and AP invoice copy from landed cost, distribution rule still show blank

entry.title: Inventory Ageing Report in SAP B1
entry.content:
When we run the Inventory Aging Report for all items across all warehouses, the item appears with movement quantity and value even though its current On-Hand = 0.

However, when we run the same report using a From Item Code = To Item Code ( filtering the report for the same specific item code only, e.g., RKM001 to RKM001), the item does not appear and no value is shown.

This creates an inconsistency between:

  • Run for All Items / All Warehouses → Item appears with Qty/Value

  • Run for the same exact item code only → Item does not appear / no value

We kindly request your advice on:

  1. Why this inconsistency happens in the report logic/filters in SAP Business One 10.0 version for SAP HANA (10.00.170) FP 2108 HOTFIX1 (64-bit)

  2. Whether there are known issues or SAP Notes related to item filtering affecting the Inventory Aging Report results.

  3. What is the recommended SAP-supported approach to validate which result is correct and how to fix it.

entry.title: Formatted Search Help
entry.content:
Hi,
This should be straight forward, but I am getting an error.  I just want to pull in the OnHand, Committed and OnOrder from OITW for UDF's

I have this formatted search, its for SQL

SELECT T0.OnHand FROM OITW T0 WHERE T0.ItemCode = $[$38.1.0]
AND T0.WhsCode= $[$38.24.0]

If I click on the magnifying glass, I get the results, but if I enter in a new item, I get this error

1). [Microsoft][ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server][SQL Server]Incorrect syntax near '40810001-CA2'.
2). [Microsoft][ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server][SQL Server]Statement(s) could not be prepared. FMS execution failed on field 'U_AI_Whse_InStock' with query name 'SO Line - InStock'

Can someone help with this?

Brian

entry.title: Is the AMC for SAP Business One Hana version calculated based on the Net Purchase Price or the Gross
entry.content: Is the Annual Maintenance Cost (AMC) for SAP Business One version for SAP HANA calculated based on the Net Purchase Price (after discounts) or the Gross List Price?

entry.title: Is SAP still investing and supporting B1if going forward?
entry.content: I'm being told by a hosting company that B1if has not been investing in B1if for several years and doesnt plan to going forward. They also mention it is not a good product to use and that scalable, API‑driven technologies are the industry standard now. Can anyone confirm this?

entry.title: SAP Business One 10.0 (HANA/SQL) – Multiple phantom sessions/windows appearing when switching tabs
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

We are observing unusual UI behavior in SAP Business One 10.0 regarding session window management. I would appreciate any insights or references to relevant SAP Notes.

Problem Description: While only a single user session is active, the application appears to redundantly multiply its presence in the OS task switcher (Alt+Tab view) whenever focus is shifted between SAP B1 and external applications (e.g., Excel, Chrome,.etc.).

Technical Details:

  • Version: SAP Business One 10.0 (HANA).

  • Observed Behavior: Each time a user toggles focus (Alt+Tab) or switches between internal SAP modules, a new "phantom" window instance appears in the task switcher, despite no additional sessions being initiated.

  • Environment: SAP Client

  • Impact: This creates significant navigation clutter and makes it difficult for users to identify the active window.

Has anyone encountered this ghosting effect in Version 10? We are currently investigating whether this is a Client-side rendering bug, a display scaling issue, or specific to the RDS environment.

Best regards,

Sunil Patil

Certified SAP Business One Consultant

entry.title: Fixed asset: Asset Class without Useful Life
entry.content:
Hello folks,

I'm trying to create an asset class of land that is not supposed to bear depreciation.  But the asset class module demands some value bigger than 0 as an useful life.  How could I make one?

Thank you for your help in advance.

Regards, Koichi
